subprocess_flow.description: Clearly define the scope of the data security audit, including the specific inventory management software modules, mobile solution components, data storage locations, and network segments to be assessed. Establish clear objectives for the audit, such as identifying vulnerabilities, assessing compliance with regulations, and evaluating the effectiveness of existing security controls.
success_criteria: Audit scope and objectives are clearly defined and documented
Stakeholders agree on the scope and objectives
All relevant systems and data are included in the scope

subprocess_flow.description: Perform comprehensive vulnerability assessments of the inventory management software, mobile solution, and related infrastructure using automated scanning tools and manual testing techniques. Identify potential weaknesses and vulnerabilities that could be exploited by attackers.
success_criteria: Vulnerability assessments are completed for all systems within scope
All identified vulnerabilities are documented and prioritized based on severity
Assessment tools and techniques are appropriate for the target systems

subprocess_flow.description: Conduct penetration testing to simulate real-world attacks against the inventory management software and mobile solution. Attempt to exploit identified vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access to sensitive data or systems. Assess the effectiveness of existing security controls in preventing and detecting attacks.
success_criteria: Penetration testing is conducted by qualified security professionals
All identified vulnerabilities are tested for exploitability
Penetration testing report documents all findings and recommendations

subprocess_flow.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of access controls for the inventory management software and mobile solution. Verify that user permissions are appropriately assigned and that unauthorized access is prevented. Assess the strength of password policies and multi-factor authentication mechanisms.
success_criteria: Access control review is completed for all user roles and permissions
All access control weaknesses are documented and addressed
Multi-factor authentication is enabled for all privileged accounts

subprocess_flow.description: Assess the inventory management software and mobile solution's compliance with relevant data protection regulations, such as PCI DSS (if credit card information is stored) and GDPR (if customer data is processed). Identify any gaps in compliance and recommend remediation measures.
success_criteria: Compliance assessment is completed against all relevant regulations
All compliance gaps are documented and prioritized
Remediation measures are aligned with regulatory requirements

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the findings of the vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, access control review, and compliance checks, develop a comprehensive remediation plan to address identified vulnerabilities and compliance gaps. Prioritize remediation efforts based on risk and impact.
success_criteria: Remediation plan is comprehensive and addresses all identified issues
Remediation efforts are prioritized based on risk and impact
Remediation plan includes timelines and assigned responsibilities

subprocess_flow.description: Prepare a detailed data security audit report summarizing the audit scope, objectives, methodology, findings, and recommendations. Include the remediation plan as an appendix to the report.
success_criteria: Audit report is clear, concise, and comprehensive
All findings and recommendations are supported by evidence
Audit report is reviewed and approved by stakeholders
